precondition: The Windows XP Start Menu is open.
action: Move the mouse cursor over the 'Control Panel' option in the Start Menu.
expected_results: The 'Control Panel' option in the Start Menu will become highlighted.

precondition: The Windows XP Start menu is open.
action: Click the 'Control Panel' option in the Start menu.
expected_results: The Control Panel window will open.

precondition: The "Appearance and Themes" category in the Windows XP Control Panel is highlighted, indicating the mouse cursor is hovering over it. A tooltip box with a description is visible.
action: Move the mouse cursor away from the "Appearance and Themes" icon and click outside the tooltip box.
expected_results: The "Appearance and Themes" category will no longer be highlighted, and the tooltip box will disappear.

precondition: The 'Appearance and Themes' window of the Windows XP Control Panel is open.
The 'Display Properties' window is open and the 'Themes' tab is active.
expected_results: The 'Display Properties' window will display the 'Screen Saver' tab contents. A preview window showing the 'Windows XP' logo on a black background will appear.

precondition: The 'Screen Saver' tab of the 'Display Properties' window is open and the 'Screen saver' dropdown menu is visible.
action: Click the dropdown arrow on the 'Screen saver' dropdown menu.
expected_results: A list of available screensavers will appear.

precondition: The 'Screen Saver' dropdown menu in the 'Display Properties' window is open.
action: Click anywhere outside the 'Screen Saver' dropdown menu.
expected_results: The 'Screen Saver' dropdown menu will close.

precondition: The 'Display Properties' window is open and the 'Screen Saver' tab is selected.
action: Click the 'Power...' button at the bottom of the 'Display Properties' window.
expected_results: The 'Display Properties' window will close, and the 'Power Options Properties' window will open to the 'Power Schemes' tab.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Home/Office Desk" power scheme is selected.
action: Click the dropdown menu labeled "System hibernates".
expected_results: A list of time interval options will appear.

precondition: The 'System hibernates' dropdown menu within the 'Power Options Properties' window is open.
action: Click on any empty space within the 'System hibernates' dropdown menu.
expected_results: The 'System hibernates' dropdown menu will close.

precondition: The 'Power Options Properties' window is open and the 'Power Schemes' tab is selected.
action: Click the dropdown arrow of the 'Power schemes' list box.
expected_results: A dropdown menu will appear, displaying a list of available power schemes.

precondition: The 'Power Options Properties' window is open and the 'Power Schemes' tab is selected. The 'Power schemes' dropdown menu at the top of the window should be visible.
expected_results: Two buttons, 'Save As' and 'Delete', will appear next to the 'Power schemes' dropdown menu.

precondition: The 'Power Options Properties' window is open, and the 'Power Schemes' tab is selected. The 'Power schemes' dropdown menu should display 'Always On'.
action: Click the dropdown button for the 'Turn off hard disks' setting.
expected_results: A dropdown menu will appear, displaying a list of time intervals to choose from for the 'Turn off hard disks' setting.

precondition: The 'Power Options Properties' window is open and the 'Always On' power scheme is selected.
action: Click the dropdown button labeled 'After 20 mins' next to the 'Turn off monitor' setting.
expected_results: A dropdown menu with a list of time interval options will appear.

precondition: The 'Power Options Properties' window is open and the 'Power Schemes' tab is selected. The 'Power schemes' dropdown menu displays 'Always On'. The 'System hibernates' dropdown menu is open.
action: Click the 'Never' option in the 'System hibernates' dropdown menu.
expected_results: The 'Never' option will be selected in the 'System hibernates' dropdown menu.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open with the "Always On" power scheme selected.
expected_results: The "Power Options Properties" window will close. Any changes made to the power scheme settings will be discarded.

precondition: The 'Display Properties' window is open, showing the 'Screen Saver' tab. The mouse cursor is hovering over the 'OK' button.
expected_results: The 'Display Properties' window will close. The 'Appearance and Themes' window will become visible, showing common tasks and Control Panel icons.

precondition: The 'Appearance and Themes' window is visible.
action: Click the 'Close' button in the upper-right corner of the 'Appearance and Themes' window.
expected_results: The 'Appearance and Themes' window will close.
